wikipedia_page.main: William Frankel (3 February 1917 – 18 April 2008) was the editor of the British weekly newspaper The Jewish Chronicle from 1958 until 1977. He wrote the books Friday Nights (1973), Israel Observed (1980), Survey of Jewish Affairs (1982–1992), and Tea With Einstein and Other Memories (2006).

response: * William Frankel (1903–2008), editor of the British weekly newspaper, The Jewish Chronicle, from 1958 to 1977

Sanders, Duke; Peter Stein, Regius Professor of Civil Law (Cambridge); Géza Vermes, Oxford; Alan Watson, law faculties at the universities of Georgia, Edinburgh, and Belgrade; Reuven Yaron, Hebrew University of Jerusalem.
* William Frankel, , Editor, The Jewish Chronicle.

Kessler became the managing director of The Jewish Chronicle in London in 1935. In 1946, he dismissed the editor, Ivan Greenberg, who was deemed too divisive. Instead, he appointed John Maurice Shaftesley, who remained in the post until 1958, when he hired William Frankel.
